description: telnet — user interface to the TELNET protocol

global_flags.description: an 8-bit data path.  This causes an attempt to nego‐ tiate the TELNET BINARY option on both input and output.
This causes the BINARY option to be negotiated on output.
bind to specific local ADDRESS
turn on debugging
disable type ATYPE authentication
encrypt the data stream, if possible
character  to  escape-char.  If escape-char is omitted, then there will be no escape character.
give this help list
use only IPv4
use only IPv6

Currently, this sends the  user  name via the USER variable of the ENVIRON option if supported by the remote  system.   The  name used is that of the current user as returned by getlogin(2) if it agrees with the current user  ID, otherwise it is the name associated with the user ID.
any character from being recognized as an escape charac‐ ter.
do not automatically login to the remote system
file.   (See  the toggle skiprc command on this man page.)

Kerberos  authentication  is  being used, the -k option re‐ quests that telnet obtain tickets for the remote host in  realm realm  instead  of  the  remote  host's realm, as determined by krb_realmofhost(3).
In this mode, the  escape character is set to the tilde (~) character, unless modified by the -e option.
See  the  set tracefile command below.
give a short usage message

connecting to the remote system, if the remote system un‐ derstands the ENVIRON option, then user will be sent to the re‐ mote system as the value for the variable  USER.   This  option implies  the  -a option.  This option may also be used with the open command.
print program version
